subtitle: Add a cheesy filling and serve with salad leaves for a stylish lunch.

method.text: Sift the flour and seasoning into a bowl. Make a well in the centre and add the egg, egg yolk and half the milk.

Using a wooden spoon, stir from the centre, gradually drawing in the flour from around the sides of the bowl. Beat well to form a smooth batter. Then add remaining milk and melted butter or oil. Stir the walnuts into the batter mixture.
Heat a 15 cm pancake pan and grease lightly using a piece of kitchen paper smeared in oil. Pour in enough batter to thinly cover the base of the pan, tilting the pan to give an even thickness.
Cook for 1-2 min until golden, then toss or turn the pancake over using a palette knife and cook the other side for 1-2 min until golden.
Turn the pancake out of the pan onto kitchen paper. Continue layering the pancakes, interleaved with kitchen paper, until all the batter is used, oiling the pan after cooking each pancake.
